org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException: Cannot create configuration in
file:/C:/eclipse/configuration/

This is the reason why eclipse does not start. Perhaps you are not allowed to write there or not enough space on your disk?

Move to Platform/Update where the exception occured for follow-up on this issue

we need more information on this.
- how did you get to this state?
- do you write privileges on configuration directory?
and any other information you have and you think it might help us.

Hi ALl:

I've solved this issue.

By using the command line:

eclipse -vm and then specify a JDK higher than 1.4.2

Thanks.
